ratings.comment: One of the best professors I've ever had. Very thought provoking discussions. Be ready to challenge your beliefs.

His class is important, and the topics discussed are meaningful, but he is very unorganized. It's hard to know what's expected of you, and he doesn't update Canvas with grades. His grading seems arbitrary and instructions for papers are unclear and vague. Would recommend a different course for sure.

he doesn't deserve this bad reviews. jesus. AA151 is the best class i've ever taken. he's really passionate about everything he talks about, which is why people say his lectures are intense. there's an okay amount of writing- about 1-1 1/2 pages single spaced per week, then 2 big ones in the middle and end of the semester. don't procrastinate.

Do not take this class. Wait a semester, if you cannot find any other ethnic studies class. Professor Thornton teaches absolutely no material and just keeps yapping in lecture about the same stuff - (whites are worst, blacks are best). There is too much work involved (manual labour mostly) for the class. Again, for your own sake, skip it.

While Professor Thornton Had some interesting content Afro 151, I would not recommend taking it. It is far too much work for a three credit course once you factor in the biweekly papers, larger writing assignments, readings, and volunteer work. His directions are frequently unclear too, and don't expect a response to your emails.

This class requires a lot of work. However, it is extremely eye opening especially for many of the people of Madison who come from primarily white neighborhoods. Professor Thornton exposes real life struggles of minorities and is very passionate. Not difficult to do well in this class as long as you go to lecture and put thought into your writing.

Way too much work for an elementary 3 credit class. The content was very thought provoking and causes you to question others as well as yourself. Take the class if you feel like you need to be knowledged on what's going on in the contemporary society of African Americans, as well as poor people. But be prepared to write papers almost every week

Far too much work for a 3 credit course, and the mandatory service learning would have been cool if it didn't take up 5 hours of every week. Professors views were extremely one sided only way to get a good grade is to write exactly what he wants to hear. This course should be taught by a professor who does not take his anger out on students' grades
Heavy weighted final group project with unclear expectations. Material can be redundant week to week.

I regret taking this class. The teacher expects you read 200 pages a week and sit in class for 3 hours discussing the readings. He gets upset when students don't know what to say about a topic and he NEVER RESPONDS TO EMAILS. I would say only take this class if you are a afro-American studies major.

Class is  interesting and definitely makes you think. However, I have never had a professor who respects me less. He does NOT reply to emails unless he deems it a worthy question. The emails he does reply to are usually one-worded, not even a hello.  He also makes you feel stupid for being confused by his unclear syllabus and overall is just rude.

DONT DO IT. As interesting as the material was, please do not take this class. The prof presents all of material in a super biased way and expects you to agree with everything hes says. If you do not agree your grade will suffer. Lots of readings, super strict grader, and hes not afraid to make you re-write essays. JUST DONT

Great Professor. Not the easiest grader, but very helpful in helping the student improve their own quality of work. Is also very understanding of different student situation, which makes him one of the more flexible professors. Always in office, available.

REALLY strict and stubborn prof. If you don't give him what he wants to hear, he will grade you bad. Also, very harsh grader. Responds only once every 20 emails. This guy is not flexible at all. Unless you're really into what he's doing, avoid him at all cost. I will flat out say this:He has his own logic and if you don't follow it,you're screwed.
Great Person. Great Course.. You should take this class

It may have a lot of work but it's worth it. I've learned SO much and feel like a better person because of this class. Volunteering with low-income children was a great experience. Love the class, well worth the work required. Prof. is relatable and keeps things interesting.

This class is service-learning, and pretty labor intensive for only 3 credits (3 one page journal entries/week, papers, final project, etc). That said, it is an extremely relevant subject, regardless of race. Lectures are always interesting, but at times course material can get uncomfortable. Overall it's an excellent class and you'll learn a lot.
such a great class. prof has a lot to add and obviously knows a lot about the topic. i always loved going to this class. not the easiest grader, but worth the time and effort
